greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of multisets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Column k > 1 is asymptotic to k^n * exp(2*sqrt(n) - 1/2 + c(k)) / (2 * sqrt(Pi) * n^(3/4)), where c(k) = Sum_{m>=2} 1/(m*(k^(m-1)-1)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 14 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
Vaclav Kotesovec, A method of finding the asymptotics of q-series based on the convolution of generating functions, arXiv:1509.08708 [math.CO], Sep 30 2015, p. 27.
formula: Column k is Euler transform of the powers of k.
T(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..k} C(k,i) * A257740(n,k-i). - _Alois P. Heinz_, May 08 2015
maple: with(numtheory): etr:= proc(p) local b; b:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(d*p(d), d=divisors(j)) *b(n-j), j=1..n)/n) end end: A:= (n,k)-> etr(j->k^j)(n); seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..14);
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[ Product[1/(1-x^j)^(k^j), {j, 1, n}], {x, 0, n}]; a[0, _] = 1; a[_?Positive, 0] = 0;
Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 0, 14}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2014 *)
etr[p_] := Module[{b}, b[n_] := b[n] = If[n==0, 1, Sum[Sum[d p[d], {d, Divisors[j]}] b[n-j], {j, 1, n}]/n]; b];
Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 30 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 09 2008
ext: Name changed by _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 21 2018
